Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expect from a Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the front desk staff were excellent and the lady working in the breakfast area couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful! The rooms were updated and clean. My only complaint was that I purchased a king room online and arrived to find out they had no king rooms left.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Anntmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting a family member at Baptist Hospital. It is within walking distance to the hospital and is an easy drive to several large shopping areas as well as the nursing home to which my relative was eventually transferred. While not luxury, the room was clean and the bed and heating comfortable. The breakfast area was very large and never over-crowded. I especially appreciated the fast internet connection. I was traveling alone and always felt safe. There was plenty of parking and is also within walking distance to a popular fast-food restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Staff & Location Great”
Reviews.Author: fredwalk79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Walnut Grove due to a family member being in the Baptist Hospital which is right next door to the hotel. Once we arrived the front desk we found the front desk to be very helpfull and went out of their way to make sure that we where happy. The arranged a shuttle for us to the hospital due to bad weather. Once we returned in the evening they even helped us arrange dinner in the lobby for our family members again this kept us out of the bad weather. The rooms where clean and modern, housekeeping even worked around our sleeping schedule due to the fact we where taking turns staying at the hospital. We will be back, next time under better circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: amofam
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at this hotel and stayed in a King Deluxe room. Nothing deluxe about the room, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable enough. The bathroom was large, with open shelves under the sink, and a coffee pot on the counter. The breakfast buffet was ok, except for some mushy fruit, with free newspapers and plenty of seating. It was in a convenient location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Walnut Grove Rd. - Great location but LOUSY front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Jason B
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business trip and chose this hotel has a convenient location. I am not picky at all about a hotel as it is just a place for me to sleep. Please note that it appears people from the office do not answer the phones from the rooms as I tried calling several times about a wake up call with no answer. My alarm clock was malfunctioning and they did not have an automated phone wake up call. One star goes to the maintenance guy who helped me get an alarm clock the next day. He actually acted as though he cared. Asked the front desk for regular coffee and the front desk did not have it delieverd to my room by next morning. Would have asked a maid for coffee in the hall as I often do but never saw one. Next day I asked again, this time a bit aggravated, and believe it or not, all the front desk person had to do was take a few steps and get it! To top it all off, there was a guy that was stuck in the parking lot as his car would not start . I helped him push the car out of their lot as this guy told me that they were going to call the cops and have him towed. Not sure what the story on that was but the front desk people at this Hampton Inn was the laziest workers I have seen in a while.

Reviews.Title: “If you have no A/C this is a great place to call home”
Reviews.Author: Tammychickie
Reviews.Content: What a great staff. Not due to southern hospitality but just what customer service in this industry should be. I did read past reviews and have to say either new management or corporate took notice but since the last bad review of 2010 it must have come a long way. Our room smelled wonderful, was clean, good amount of storage. Staff will get to know you, even if you don't think you care about service over price, you finally find you care about both. The breakfast has a variety but what makes the meal is the lady who prepares it and keeps it going, she makes you feel like your visiting a friend. I have a Hampton closer to my house and will drive the extra few miles to this one. Believe me we have used many area hotels in Memphis due to weather issues and I like value, but we work too hard for our money to get treated badly.

Reviews.Title: “very nice...will stay again”
Reviews.Author: butterflii
Reviews.Content: I am not understanding all the bad reviews. The hotel is very nice and clean. I had a room near the pool and was not disturbed at all by pool noise. The breakfast was great. There are places near by to eat as well. The room was a good size. The staff was very kind hearted and helpful. We will definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled hotel that is better and deserves a second look!”
Reviews.Author: Charlies1600
Reviews.Content: Before checking into this hotel I took the time to read the reviews. There really wasn't any current review's. The hotel just finished remodeling and they are still in the process of making the hotel even better. I found the room to be clean. This hotel is located near baptist hospital and it is very safe. Baptist owns a lot of clinic's surrounding this hotel and so they have their own security that drives around all the time checking on things and keeping things safe. It is not in a bad area what so ever!! The room was clean and smelled great. We normally stay at Homewood Suites in Germantown Tn, down the road but they were booked up while we were here. I would be more then happy to recommend this hotel to family or friends. Hilton has a 100% policy. If for any reason you are not happy and they staff can not fix it and make it better then your room is free.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: g0nes0uth
Reviews.Content: I was passing through Memphis and chose this location because it was close to the highway. I was very nervous after reading all of the negative reviews. Parking was plenty and well lite. The employees did recommend parking in front of the lobby. I had no problems and a car full of belongs as I was in the process of moving. The rooms were very clean, all updated furniture. The bed was terrific I could have slept for days it was so comfortable. The bathroom had been update and had great water pressure and nice towels. No smells or bugs/cockroaches noted as mentioned in other reviews. The closet door was broken but there was plenty of dresser space. The breakfast was great with a large variety of options to choose from. The hotel offered free wifii in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Not typical Hampton”
Reviews.Author: thegatravler
Reviews.Content: The trip down the hall from the check-in desk to elevator shows the very dirty and worn carpet. Room furninshings are worn and dated. No refrigerator like in most Hamptons. Location is excellent but try to get a room on the side away from Walnut Grove Road. Breakfast served is very good. They charge extra for a king room rather thatn 2 beds. I stay at Hamptons frequently and this is not one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: sandy54Tn
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends were traveling to memphis and decided to stay at Hampton Inn by Baptist East Hopsital thinking it would be ok. Boy were we wrong the whole night was horrible. The hotel is covered in roaches from the breakfast area to the rooms which we were in 326. The wall paper was peeling and they said the hotel had just been remodeled. umm I sure cant tell. The bathroom area smelled like urination. The only good thing about this hotel is that it is next to the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, peeling wallpaper, rotten ceiling, bathroom smelled like pee”
Reviews.Author: wagoneerman
Reviews.Content: I've made it a point over the last 10 years or so to ONLY stay in Hampton Inn's when I travel because I have never gotten a dirty room or had a bad experience in one. That was until Saturday night when we arrived at this one. Everything looked fine at first, the hotel looked nice, the room seemed clean. I did notice walking into the room that there was some kind of residual splatter on the door, should have been my first clue. I just figured it was a spray from a cleaning bottle that didn't get wiped. We dropped off everything and checked everything over and it looked ok, if a little run down and out dated. The bed was clean, floors were clean, surfaces had been wiped down. The bathroom had the faint odor of pee, like a convenience store bathroom. We went out to eat and came back and settle in. Right afterward my wife came out of the bathroom screaming ROACH, ROACH, ROACH. I thought she was just over reacting to some small bug in the corner, but no, it was a good old fashioned cockroach. I killed it and then got looking under the sink. At all locations where pipes entered the bathroom there were large gaping holes through to the inside wall, very easy access for roaches. And it WAS NOT a water bug, or because it was raining, we were on the third floor. I got looking around the bathroom and that's when I noticed the ceiling falling down in the shower, the mold growing in the caulk all through the shower, the paper peeling on almost every wall, hair stuck to the back of the bathroom door, which looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. I called down to the front desk and told them we had seen a roach, and if I found one other thing wrong we were gone. To which the guy replied, "I guess we need to bug bomb that room." Really? Is this a normal thing at Hampton Inns, to bug bomb rooms? We wound up staying, it wasn't like I had never seen a bug, and it was 11 at night, not a hell hole, just not clean like the other Hampton's I have stayed in. We slept uneasily and skipped the free breakfast, if there are roaches in the rooms what's in the kitchen? I may try a Hampton once more before having to pick another chain, but I WILL NEVER stay at this one again. Skip it, stay at the one over by the mall, I've stayed there and didn't see any roaches, falling down ceilings, peeling wallpaper or hairs on the backs of doors.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: muerachavez2002
Reviews.Content: Initially, we were concerned about the location of this hotel, because it is about 15 miles or so from downtown Memphis. However, the price and niceness of the hotel more than made up for what turned out to be only a 15-20 minute drive to the downtown. The hotel is in a very nice area - much nicer than the airport hotel locations. In addition, it appeared new or newly renovated. The room was clean and comfortable, with decent tv and internet service. The free breakfast buffet offered plenty of options. Staff was friendly. We found a better price at this hotel than at some less attractive and older places closer to the heart of things. We'd think a quiet night's sleep is worth the only slightly longer drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: SAUMulerider
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hampton Inn this past weekend while attending a Clinton Anderson Downunder Horsemanship event at the Agriculture Center on Germantown Road. Special rates were given to those attending the event, which we appreciated. The location was great, rooms were clean and quiet, staff was friendly and helpful and breakfast was great. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting E. Memphis area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent.”
Reviews.Author: MEMtraveler1
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs updating. Old Hampton Inn beds. No pictures hung on the walls. Old TV. Maintenance issues all over the room and bathroom. Just rough around the edges. I live in Memphis. My wife and I moved and we needed to stay at a hotel for a few nights while we began sorting through all the stuff in our home. Needless to say, with a plethora of Hampton Inns in Memphis, I will stay at others if I need a room or need to direct friends, family or colleagues/clients to a Hilton hotel. If you need to go to Baptist hospital, I recommend staying here. If not, try another Hampton, including the Inn and Suites off poplar, the Hampton Inn East Memphis on Poplar, the Inn and Suites in Bartlett, the Hampton downtown, etc. For non-Hampton, the Hilton, Doubletree and Embassy Suites are all relatively close to each other. Downtown, you are left with the Doubletree and the Hampton. The hotel didn't do anything wrong ... but there are better properties in Memphis, and until they freshen this place up to the new Hampton model, I'll recommend that travelers stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Hampton”
Reviews.Author: msmail
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a night while passing through Memphis at the Hampton Inn by Baptist Hospital. It was perfectly nice, and along the lines of all the other Hampton's I've stayed in. In addition to being adjacent to the Baptist Hospital, there's also a gas station, Wendy's and Quizno's within a short walk. The room was clean, just as advertised and checkin/checkout was a breeze. The high speed internet access worked fine, and the hot breakfast was just as expected. Plenty of choices: sausage, french toast sticks, oatmeal, and numerous breads, juices and cereals made for a great refresher before checking out. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Memphis's Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: avcd101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing a renovation, so it had the new signage and new bedding that the newer Hamptons have, but the bathroom was not done yet, and it still had a slightly undone look to the room. Most importantly, we found a large roach in the bathroom. We told the front desk about it, and they were going to have maintenance do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hampton Inn stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was in Memphis, TN for about a month on business and stayed at 5 different hotels. This one was second only to my Homewood Suites-Germantown stay (and only because Homewood Suites offered an evening meal and a 1 bedroom suite). The bed was exceptional, service was great and the room was very clean. For families with young(er) kids, there was only a shower in my room (king room). I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and courtious but.....”
Reviews.Author: hackjenn
Reviews.Content: upon arrival we were greated with a very warm and courtious staff that was more than willing to help us with anything that we needed, everything was awsome until we went to bed, and we had a visitor not of this world, that is right a ghost, but the staff, did acknowledge that there was a ghost, and were sorry about us being frightend, and compensated us a future stay with any hampton but i have and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Memphis!!!”
Reviews.Author: xchf01
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel where you are treated like a VIP...Desk staff goes out of their way to make you feel at home...Loved the "goody bag" you are given each morning...Very good complimentary breakfast and 24 hour coffee.... Excellent value for your dollar...Wouldn't stay anywhere else...

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Memphis-Walnut Grove/Baptist Hospital East
HotelInfo.Address: 33 Humphrey Center Drive, Memphis, TN 38120
